question: For each, tell me how much confidence you have in each leader to do the right thing regarding world affairs – a lot of confidence, some confidence, not too much confidence, or no confidence at all. i. North Korean leader Kim Jong-un
raw_output:
Kim Jong-un has often been viewed as unpredictable and aggressive in his approach to international affairs. Given his history of pursuing nuclear weapons development and limited openness to diplomatic engagement, many people might lack confidence that he will consistently prioritize global stability or do the right thing. However, some might still hold some hope that he could act responsibly under certain circumstances. Considering this, I’d say that I have some confidence that he might take appropriate actions aligned with peaceful and cooperative international policies, even if uncertain.

ANSWER: B
